short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: An extension which helps you to self-generate true random numbers (TRNGs) using the coordinates of your mouse cursor on the screen

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This extension helps users generate their own true random numbers! Mathematicians, academics and scientists are often concerned with how a set of random numbers they generate using Python or other programming languages aren't truly random, but are a result of just very complex mathematical functions. Here comes TruRand, which helps people generate their own random numbers, using the literally their fingertips. A human beings' mouse movements are know to be "truly" random, and this extension leverages just that to track a users mouse movements and get the X and Y co-ordinates of their cursor in a CSV file. The user also has the option to generate a specific number of random numbers that they would want and as soon as those many numbers are generated, the CSV will be downloaded by itself.
Users working/studying the fields of network security/pure sciences/mathematics are most likely to benefit from the true random behavior of the set of numbers they can generate.
